description: Old Delhi (National Capital Territory of Delhi)
timings: 09:30 AM – 4:30 PM (Closed on Mondays / special events)
entry_fee: Indian Visitors ~₹35, Foreign Visitors ~₹550 (subject to ASI updates)
accessibility: Partial wheelchair access; road access good but narrow lanes nearby
guided_tours: Local guides available in English/Hindi; ASI audio/guide options sometimes available
parking: Limited nearby parking; paid parking around Chandni Chowk / Sunehri Masjid
nearby_amenities: Chandni Chowk eateries, street food, small shops, public toilets
special_notes: Iconic Mughal fort; Independence Day flag hoisting & official ceremonies held annually; heavy crowds during festivals and national events

category: Historical Monument / UNESCO World Heritage Site
description: Mehrauli (National Capital Territory of Delhi)
timings: 7:00 AM – 5:00 PM (Sunrise to sunset; closed on certain national holidays)
entry_fee: Indian Visitors ~₹35, Foreign Visitors ~₹550–₹600 (subject to ASI updates)
accessibility: Partial wheelchair access; some uneven pathways
guided_tours: Local guides available in English/Hindi; audio guide options sometimes available
nearby_amenities: Cafes and restaurants nearby; restrooms; small shops
special_notes: Part of Qutub complex with Iron Pillar; UNESCO World Heritage site; security checks enforced

category: War Memorial / Open Monument / Park area
description: Central Delhi (National Capital Territory of Delhi)
metro_station: Central Secretariat / Patel Chowk / Udyog Bhawan
accessibility: Wheelchair friendly; wide paved pathways
guided_tours: City guides and HOHO buses include India Gate
parking: Nearby paid parking (Connaught Place / Raisina Hill)
nearby_amenities: Restaurants, cafes, souvenir stalls, restrooms
special_notes: War memorial for WWI soldiers; heavy crowds on national holidays; popular for evening walks and photography

category: Historical Monument / UNESCO World Heritage Site
description: Nizamuddin / Mathura Road (National Capital Territory of Delhi)
entry_fee: Indian Visitors ~₹35, Foreign Visitors ~₹550–₹600; photography fees may apply
accessibility: Garden pathways partially wheelchair-friendly; some uneven heritage paths
guided_tours: Local guides available; ASI signage and audio guides available
parking: Nearby parking at Nizamuddin / Mathura Road
nearby_amenities: Cafes, Nizamuddin Dargah precincts, restrooms, small shops
special_notes: Mughal architecture precursor to Taj Mahal; UNESCO World Heritage Site; large gardens and tomb complexes

description: Kalkaji / Bahapur (National Capital Territory of Delhi)
timings: 8:30 AM – 6:00 PM (Tuesday–Sunday; check official site for seasonal updates)
accessibility: Wheelchair-friendly; garden pathways and meditation hall accessible
guided_tours: Volunteer staff explain visitor etiquette; formal guided tours generally not conducted inside the hall
nearby_amenities: Gardens, small cafes nearby, restrooms
special_notes: Famous lotus-shaped architecture; open to people of all religions; photography and silence etiquette enforced

description: Old Delhi (National Capital Territory of Delhi)
timings: 7:00 AM – 12:00 PM & 1:30 PM – 6:30 PM (visiting outside prayer hours)
accessibility: Stone steps; not fully wheelchair-friendly
guided_tours: Local guides available (English/Hindi)
parking: Very limited; use nearby paid parking at Chandni Chowk
nearby_amenities: Famous street food (parathas, kebabs), markets (Chandni Chowk), shops, restrooms
special_notes: One of India’s largest mosques; access restricted during prayer times and festivals

description: Old Delhi Market & Heritage Area (National Capital Territory of Delhi)
timings: 10:00 AM – 8:00 PM (varies; some early morning shops open)
accessibility: Narrow lanes; not wheelchair-friendly in many parts; crowded
guided_tours: Heritage walks and food walks available (English/Hindi)
parking: Limited; park in nearby lots and walk
nearby_amenities: Eateries, sweet shops, jewelry and textile shops, restrooms
special_notes: Historic market near Red Fort & Jama Masjid; famous for street food and traditional shops

description: Central Delhi (National Capital Territory of Delhi)
timings: Mughal Gardens open during March–April (spring season), 9:00 AM – 4:00 PM
entry_fee: Free; guided tours for residence require prior booking
metro_station: Central Secretariat Metro Station (Yellow & Violet Lines)
accessibility: Gardens partially wheelchair-friendly; guided tour routes manageable
guided_tours: Prior booking needed for inside Rashtrapati Bhavan; guided garden tours available
parking: Limited onsite parking during garden open days
nearby_amenities: Cafes/restrooms at designated spots; shops Not documented
special_notes: Presidential residence; Mughal Gardens seasonal access; Indo-Saracenic architecture

description: Saidul Ajaib / Mehrauli (National Capital Territory of Delhi)
accessibility: Wheelchair-friendly; well-maintained paved paths
guided_tours: Available on request; photography and nature walks encouraged
nearby_amenities: Cafes, restrooms, small shops
special_notes: Includes themed gardens, cultural exhibits, sculptures, and fountains; ideal for nature photography and leisure

description: New Delhi (National Capital Territory of Delhi)
accessibility: Wheelchair-friendly; well-maintained pathways; popular for morning walks and jogs
nearby_amenities: Cafes, restaurants, restrooms, Khan Market shopping area
special_notes: Spread over 90 acres, the garden houses tombs from the Sayyid and Lodi dynasties, including Sikandar Lodi's tomb and the Bara Gumbad mosque.

description: Chanakyapuri (National Capital Territory of Delhi)
metro_station: Lok Kalyan Marg Metro Station (Yellow Line)
accessibility: Wheelchair-friendly; interactive exhibits suitable for all ages
guided_tours: Available; audio guides and guided tours in multiple languages
nearby_amenities: Cafes, souvenir shops, restrooms
special_notes: The museum showcases India's railway heritage, featuring vintage locomotives, royal coaches, and interactive displays.

description: Pragati Maidan (National Capital Territory of Delhi)
timings: 10:00 AM – 5:00 PM (closed on Holi and Diwali)
accessibility: Fully wheelchair-accessible; interactive and engaging exhibits for children and adults
guided_tours: Available; educational programs and workshops conducted regularly
nearby_amenities: Cafes, restaurants, restrooms
special_notes: The centre features a wide range of exhibits on science and technology, including a 3D theatre and interactive displays.

description: Hauz Khas (National Capital Territory of Delhi)
timings: Shops and cafes typically open from 10:00 AM – 10:00 PM
accessibility: Partially wheelchair-accessible; cobblestone streets may be challenging
nearby_amenities: Boutiques, art galleries, cafes, restaurants, restrooms
special_notes: A blend of medieval history and modern culture, featuring a historic water tank, Islamic monuments, and a vibrant urban village atmosphere.

description: New Delhi (National Capital Territory of Delhi)
accessibility: Wheelchair-friendly; well-maintained pathways
nearby_amenities: Cafes, restaurants, restrooms
special_notes: A late Mughal architecture marvel, often referred to as a 'mini Taj Mahal,' built in 1754 for Nawab Safdarjung.

description: Kashmere Gate (National Capital Territory of Delhi)
timings: Sunday services: Winter 9:00 AM; Summer 8:30 AM; open for visitors on weekdays 9:00 AM – 5:00 PM
metro_station: Kashmere Gate Metro Station (Red, Yellow & Violet Lines)
accessibility: Wheelchair-accessible; well-maintained interiors; colonial-era architecture with pews and high ceilings
guided_tours: Not documented; local guides sometimes available for historical insights
nearby_amenities: Cafes and eateries in the surrounding Kashmere Gate area; restrooms nearby; souvenir shops limited
special_notes: One of the oldest churches in Delhi, built in 1826; known as the 'Skinner’s Church' (after Colonel James Skinner); British-era colonial architecture; peaceful site amidst busy city traffic; ideal for photography and historical interest.

description: Connaught Place (National Capital Territory of Delhi)
metro_station: Rajiv Chowk Metro Station (Yellow & Blue Lines)
accessibility: Partially wheelchair-friendly; some structures have steep steps
guided_tours: Local guides available in English/Hindi
nearby_amenities: Restaurants, cafes, shops, restrooms
special_notes: Built in 1724 by Maharaja Jai Singh II; collection of architectural astronomical instruments.

description: Mathura Road / Pragati Maidan (National Capital Territory of Delhi)
accessibility: Garden pathways mostly accessible; some uneven stone areas
guided_tours: Local guides available; heritage walks sometimes organized
nearby_amenities: Cafes, souvenir shops, restrooms
special_notes: One of Delhi’s oldest forts; museum inside; hosts cultural events and sound-light shows.

description: Teen Murti Bhavan (National Capital Territory of Delhi)
metro_station: Lok Kalyan Marg Metro Station (Yellow Line)
accessibility: Wheelchair-friendly; indoor facilities accessible
guided_tours: Staff explain exhibits; shows available in English/Hindi
nearby_amenities: Cafes, restrooms, small gift shops
special_notes: Educational center for astronomy and space science; planetarium shows popular for students and tourists.

category: Market / Cultural & Handicraft Hub / Food Court

description: Central Delhi (National Capital Territory of Delhi)

special_notes: Home to official parades, India Gate, and Rashtrapati Bhavan view; ideal for morning/evening walks and photography.

description: Central Delhi (National Capital Territory of Delhi)

description: Connaught Place (National Capital Territory of Delhi)
metro_station: Rajiv Chowk Metro Station (Yellow & Blue Lines)
accessibility: Not fully wheelchair-accessible; stone steps and narrow spaces
guided_tours: Local guides available; photography tours sometimes organized
nearby_amenities: Cafes, restaurants, Connaught Place shopping area
special_notes: 14th-century stepwell; historic water conservation structure; popular with photographers and history enthusiasts.

description: Mehrauli / South Delhi (National Capital Territory of Delhi)
accessibility: Steep terrain; not wheelchair-friendly; trekking difficulty moderate
guided_tours: Local guides sometimes available; history tours possible
nearby_amenities: Minimal amenities; bring water and snacks
special_notes: 14th-century fort built by Ghiyas-ud-din Tughlaq; large ruins on a hill; offers panoramic views of Delhi; popular for history and photography enthusiasts.
